snippet: The British National Party, which won two seats in the European Parliament in 2009, is riven by infighting and is now on the edge of political oblivion.
abstract: England's far-right British National Party, which won two seats in European Parliament in 2009, is now riven by infighting and is on edge of oblivion; its struggles stand in stark contrast to success of several right-wing groups that have flourished elsewhere in Europe.
lead_paragraph: The British National Party, which won two seats in the European Parliament in 2009, is riven by infighting and is now on the edge of political oblivion.

headline.main: Far-Right Party Strains to Hang On in Britain
headline.print_headline: Far-Right Party Strains to Hang On in Britain
